"Now where are you hiding...?" Rise breathed, scouring what appeared to be an empty bedroom as if she hoped one of her friends might materialize on cue.

When she had suggested they play a more 'adult' game to liven up their girls' night at the Amagi Inn, she had expected to have an easier time of things than this. The game, as she had explained to little Nanako and three noticeably-flustered trio of other girls, was the same as Hide and Seek, but with one twist: For every five minutes the seeker is unable to find anyone, she must remove an article of clothing. After a few minutes of squabbling over whether or not socks counted as a single item (they totally didn't, and she had their resident detective and her masterful debating skills to thank for that), they all finally agreed, with the added condition that anyone who remains hidden is allowed to put all of their clothes back on, assuming they are able to hide for ten full minutes, and anyone who was found would switch places with the seeker. The previous seeker would then be given one minute to find a hiding spot. Hiding players could move about as they pleased, but if the seeker caught sight of them, they were caught, no questions asked. The players could hide anywhere in the inn, with the exception of the adjoining onsen.

Despite her initial uneasiness, even Yukiko had to agree with terms like those, and within minutes she had set a recurring alarm - a loud, low bell chime made by a large digital clock - to go off every five minutes, which could be heard from anywhere in the Inn, at least according to the Amagi heiress. It wasn't a perfect system, but it was likely the best they were going to be able to manage on such short notice. By the time they had all set off to hide, Rise had to admit that she had felt almost giddy at the prospect of what they were about to do. While no stranger to wearing very little in front of others, or even in front of a crowd, the added stakes still made for an exciting twist. Even little Nanako had agreed to play, her cheeks flushed as the implications of their game only half-registering in her seven-year-old brain. Rise almost wished Souji were playing as well, as she still had yet to get a straight answer out of her grey-haired senior when it came to what he thought of her during the previous day's swimsuit competition...

As part of the negotiation for the others' participation, Rise had volunteered to go first. It had seemed easy enough, after all - Naoto may have been all-but-guaranteed to choose the perfect hiding place, but Chie and Yukiko were not exactly known for their finesse or subtlety, and as smart as Nanako was for her age, she was just a child. How creative could any of their hiding spots truly be? The answer, unfortunately, turned out to be quite different than the red-headed starlet had expected. Now two and a half minutes into her search, and she hadn't found a single trace of any of them. All the girls had removed their shoes when they'd arrived, but Rise seemed to be on the path to losing another article as well.

"Using my Persona would be cheating." Rise reminded herself, staving off the small, nagging temptation. She wasn't about to cheat her friends, though, no matter how badly she wanted to win. Besides, she was fairly certain she had just figured out what she needed to do next...

The less expensive room had been combed carefully and completely by the teen idol, and still remained presentable. Rather, it will be completely searched, as soon as Rise goes through the closet. While a fairly obvious hiding spot most would have searched initially, its distance from the door to the hall led Rise to wedge a broom between the sliding door and the wall to which it slides, locking it until the broom was removed, and save it for last as she instead chose to start her search at the door to the hall and work her way outward. The door hadn't rattled and the broom remained in place. No signs of life, but any opponent could have been careful and simply sat there, hoping to not arouse suspicion and maybe Rise would forget all about the closet. Regardless, the broom slid out with a rough tug by the recovering starlet, fighting her all the way before she dropped it on the floor.

It was faint, and it stopped suddenly, but Rise was certain she heard them. Rhythmic thumping sounds were coming from the hall a moment ago. Someone was on the move, and maybe Rise could catch that someone in motion.

Rise was halfway to the door before the broom even hit the ground, her steps loudly announcing her presence and drowning out any noise that might indicate her target's location. Sliding to a stop, she swivels her head back and forth, looking down the hall in hopes of catching even the slightest glimpse of someone. Nothing, not even a shadow or sound. Being in the middle of the hallway left no clear indication of a direction to follow, and every room being unlocked offered more possible hiding places than shadows in The Midnight Channel. For no real reason, Rise bolted off to her left, mumbling prays she made the right decision rendered inaudible by her steps on the wood floor.

While still fairly early in the night, the moon illusion had dissipated and most of Inaba was dark. It meant only one thing: game time. However, they were busy mulling over what to play. Rise made a valid point in this regard, that Naoto should pick the game since she's the newest member of the group and it would serve as a sort welcoming gesture, but it didn't seem to be helping them too much. All four girls watched Naoto, whose frustration was visible even in the low light of the television.

This isn't to say that Naoto was without ideas, but she wasn't fond of any of them. Poker, Janken, and Clue gave her too much of an advantage (which was a tempting offer, but she would rather play something challenging), the Amagi Inn didn't come with too many video games, every one was a button mashers for boys around Nanako's age, and the remainder of Naoto's games couldn't be played by five players. There was one game they could all play on a predominantly level playing field and it was bound to excite Nanako since there weren't many chances for her to learn of this game, but Naoto was fairly certain that the other three didn't want to play that game. At the same time, though, Naoto had to admit that the only way to get rid of a sour taste that's been lingering in her mouth for a long while was to play this game, and she probably wasn't going to get another chance.

"Come on, Naoto-kun!" Rise urged. "I don't care what it is, we'll have fun! Just call something and end the boredom!"

After hearing the other girls offer their quiet agreement to play any game, Naoto said plainly. "As you wish. Please wait one moment while I obtain the necessary aids."

She almost didn't do it. Naoto was almost certain she'd found another game they could all play, but Rise broke her concentration before she could piece together her fragmented memory. Therefore, they were going to play the first game, even if it means the rest of them get uncomfortable again. Additionally, it'd be easy enough to convince herself that this was a mere continuation of the previous game; say Souji and Yosuke dropped out like Teddy and Kanji while Nanako jumped in, and Yukiko and Rise sobered up enough to continue playing.

"Not again!" Chie cried.

Naoto reminded her, "The agreement was you'd play anything and be content."

"But why The King's Game?"

"Since Chie-senpai and I didn't formally drop out, we didn't complete the first game, we simply ran out of time. I contend that starting something without finishing it to be the same as discarding something in the trash, and I abhor throwing away anything. Therefore, in order to become content with the game, we need to continue. Allowing Rise-chan and Yukiko-senpai to return as well as permitting Nanako-chan to enter is sportsmanship."

Chie wanted to press the issue much further, but felt Naoto's natural eloquence and quick thinking would stifle her attempts to weasel out of this game. Instead, the time and effort were refocused on explaining the game to Nanako. Certainly Yukiko and Rise didn't need to hear the rules again, they are the ones who explained it the first time. However, it was Nanako and her ignorance of the game responsible for instilling a new-found dread into Naoto and Chie.

"So I can just drop out whenever I want, but then I'm out for the rest of the game?" she asked.

While Naoto and Chie were shocked and internally berating themselves for missing such an obvious escape, Yukiko answered in their stead. "Nanako-chan, normally this is a drinking game. If you don't want to do a challenge, you wouldn't need to quit the whole game. Instead, you'd drink a shot of alcohol or something, and you'd only drop out if you got too drunk to continue or the game got too intense. Since we aren't including alcohol, we decided we have to complete every order, and can only drop out between draws."

With a grin, Rise continued, "Although, there is supposed to be a penalty for dropping out of the game, and the original can be played another way that allows us to skip orders we don't like without drinks. Should we play it that way instead?"

"Sure!" Nanako answered.

"Absolutely!" Chie answered. Finally, an out for certain orders.

"I suppose authentic would be appropriate," Naoto concurred.

"Well, if everyone else is..." Yukiko begins, blushing profusely.

She already knew this other way, having been called to rooms in the middle of such games. Unfortunately, the thought alone left her unable to vocalize the specifics and reveal Rise's plan in time to stop them. Rise's deceit could be used as a reason to invalidate the decision, but Naoto the debater was in no position to make that excuse and even nullified any such objections previously.

"Then here are the rules. The drop out penalty is one super order from the remaining players, and the way to skip challenges is to take something off."

"Eh!?" Chie and Naoto mumbled. They even had the same follow-up thought: This is a strip game, too?

"Like you said, Naoto-kun," Rise said darkly, "we agreed to play anything."

Hanging her head in defeat, Naoto mumbled, "Are slippers and socks one item or two?"

"Only one, but our ties and your hat count, too. Now then, let the games begin!"

Compared to the high spirits and playfulness of Rise and Nanako, Yukiko and Chie were agitated shadows focusing on Naoto. Their looks were piercing through the joyous atmosphere created by Nanako and Rise, and they were beginning to make Naoto feel dizzy. Even Naoto was joining in this assault. Embarrassment was her objective, she wasn't about to lie any further, but she intended to do it with everyone remaining clothed. The choice even prevented her from specifically targeting Rise in an effort to make her end the game sooner, and that's before Nanako became ecstatic over playing an adult game, even with such a disadvantage in her clothing count. She could only hope it would be a short night. And being Queen every turn would help.

Despite her normally calm demeanor, Naoto wasn't shy about her status this game. Fortunately, she remembered to conceal her number from the starlet's prying eyes. It wasn't hard to figure out who was Queen this time, even before Rise jumped out of her seat and flashed a red dot. The girls knew they were in trouble now. Yukiko and Rise knew the mechanics of this game best, but the former was more likely to play a tamer game, unless she got drunk (placebo or otherwise). And the glint in Rise's eyes only confirmed their fears: Rise wouldn't be as merciful as Naoto.

"I got this!" she said. "Just give me a minute."

She gave the room a quick glance, looking for the box she needed for the order. Nanako and Yukiko had it earlier, and they couldn't have been done with it - the Amagis bought one of those big boxes that could feed a family of six, no way those two could have finished it off already. The trick now was figuring out what they did with it. The five of them cleared some space for the game, so it was just a matter of...

"Ah-ha!" Rise called. Now she could call her order. Explain it, she reminded herself. Explain the whole thing first, then call two numbers.

Presenting the box, she continued, "All righty! I'm ordering two of you to play The Pocky Game!"

Three faces quickly fell, while Nanako cocked her head. She loved the chocolate-covered bread sticks known as Pocky, especially when her dad made her a cup of coffee, but she'd never heard of a game using them. How would it even work? Is it like an eating contest?

Stuttering and stammering, Yukiko managed to give Nanako a brief explanation, one that flustered the young girl a bit, but also got her excited. Two players take one Pocky and bite an end. The pair continue eating small bites of the stick until either one of them flinches. Naturally, should no one flinch, the duo wind up kissing. The person who flinches loses, while a kiss means it's a draw, or they could continue the game until someone does flinch. It's simple, occasionally short, and a standard for The King's Game, especially in one of those boxed versions with suggestion cards or as a penalty game.

Now it was an adult game, Nanako thought, even if I did bring up that puppy movie from America.

"There's just two little things to add," Rise continued. "We wouldn't want anyone to cheat the Queen.

"First, I'll do the draw rule, but the kiss has to be held for three seconds to be a draw. I think Naoto-kun has a good watch for the job. And second, whoever flinches first has to...tell us how much she's done with a guy. We get to ask questions, if we can tell you lied you do another penalty game, and there's no easy way out of either penalty."

The other three high school girls quickly turned several shades of red, though they weren't entirely sure of the main cause. The Pocky Game would have been embarrassing enough if it had been called during the class trip with the boys around. Knowing up front that they were going to be playing another girl only intensified those feelings, even though this was a more private setting with a smaller audience. However, in the event they did flinch, was an empty act somewhat forced upon them really as bad as revealing something they did freely? Would attempting to lie be worth the risk of a worse penalty? And choosing to skip the task meant losing a precious article of clothing very early in the game, revealing a small weakness and risking major exposure later in the game, when the orders got more distressing. The only ones not even slightly bothered by this situation were the immunized Rise and the eager Nanako.

"Now then," Rise called, piercing through the silence of her peers, "numbers. How about...1 and 3!"

"Give me a break," Naoto breathed. First Rise ruins her order, and now she's ordered the super sleuth into this situation.

Kiss or strip, Naoto mused, before realizing her other option. Maybe all she had to do was fake confidence. If her partner had a shaken demeanor, then an air of acceptance, perhaps even a little faux anticipation, would be all she'd need to bluff her opponent right out of the game. In fact, starting now might just cause her opponent to strip instead of even try playing.

Naoto happily stood, trying to be quick even though she paused after Rise finished. She flashed 1 on her lot straight to the group, feigning a partial smile and acquiring a look of restrained joy. At the moment her friends will probably find it rather suggestive, but a simple explanation later should be more than enough to eliminate this problem. Of course, that assumes they don't already know her strategy. If that happened, this would really be a game of chicken. Well, in one case that's possible. Chie hasn't once suggested that she'd be able to see through this feint, it would have to work on her. The primary concern would be Yukiko, Naoto thinks.

Naoto's smile attempted to flee when she locked eyes with her opponent, but firmly locked into a more frightened grin. Starting at the 3, her gaze followed the upstretched arm lower and lower until she reached the euphoric face of Nanako. I needed a better plan, Naoto scolds herself.

The past few months had been an eye opening period for the members of the Inaba Investigation Team. Not only had they learned a great deal about themselves, the entire existence of another plane of existence within their televisions had been revealed to them. More importantly though was what they had learned about the female members of their group. Whether it was Rise's unconscious desire to dance and strip before large audiences, Yukiko's strong desire to find her perfect prince, Naoto's own sexual confusion, or Chie's oddly strong feelings towards her best friend, Souji and the rest of the guys had gotten a rather revealing look into the ''adult'' sides of their female friends personalities. Being the young, virile teens that they were, it was no surprise that when they heard that the girls were going on a weekend retreat that they immediately began planning on ways to crash the secluded event.

It was around ten at night when the group of guys finally arrived at the backside of the Amagi Inn. A warm fall air permeated the small town with sticky dampness; a strong, rolling layer of fog was sure to form tomorrow. Luckily for the team no one had been spotted on the midnight channel, so there was little to worry about. Even better, the recent murders had cleared the late-night streets of all pedestrians, allowing the four boys to plan their strategy without fear of being spotted. Taking advantage of the situation, Yosuke spoke up.

"Okay, looks like we made it here without any trouble," the brown hair boy said. "In that case, I officially call the first meeting of the female investigation team to order!"

"Oh boy, oh boy, oh boy!" the often-excitable Teddie said, "I can't wait to finally score!"

"Wait, WHAT? We're going to d-do stuff with em?" Kanji said, unable to hide his terror. Though he liked women, he held a deep seated fear of most things sexual. It had been nearly impossible for the guys to convince him to come with, but the last minute promise of a "looking, no touching" policy had been enough to assuage his worries.

"Calm down, Kanji, Ted's just being an idiot," Yosuke said, "The plan's the same as it was before. We go in, we hide, and we enjoy the view. That's it. No taking things, no interaction, nothing."

Teddie replied with a disappointed grimace, but even he knew Yosuke was right. Getting caught was more likely to result in an ass-kicking than any sort of scoring. Not to mention the awkward atmosphere the next few investigation meetings would have if they were actually caught.

"Alright then, let's begin. Souji, since your the leader of us all, you should probably choose where we enter, right?"

Souji replied with one of his solemn, silent nods. The leader of the team rarely spoke, but his words often held enough meaning to inspire confidence in the rest. Tonight it seemed was no different. Souji turned and looked at the foreboding fortress of an Inn behind him. Of the countless windows lining the wall, only about five rooms seemed to have lights on, all on the ground floor. Even better, the heat had made leaving the windows open a necessity, giving the group a perfect opportunity to enter.

With no real info to go on, Souji picked the center window at seemingly random. After quickly popping his head in to check if it was empty, he slowly pulled himself through the ancient wooden frame. After one more brief surveillance of the surroundings , he ushered in the rest of the group, helping the other three get in without so much as a peep.

"Alright," Yosuke whispered, "We made it in. Looks like we're in..."

info.description:
During a lull in the investigation to find the mysterious killer that has been plaguing Inaba, the ladies of the investigation team decide to have a night to themselves at the Amagi Inn. No boys allowed. Yukiko's parents are away, and the building is closed to the public temporarily, so the girls have the place to themselves. They decide to invite Souji's young cousin Nanako too.

         You take on the role of one the girls attending the slumber party, or Souji Seta, as he leads the not so intrepid group of male investigation team members to the inn, so that they may finally see what their female colleges look like naked. As a girl, your goal will be to get through the party with your modesty intact while competing in the various games and other activities which try to rob you of your clothing. You will also try to make sure your fellow attendees don't end up as modest. Your goal is to be queen of the party, after all. As Souji and boys, your goal will be to see every girl naked without getting caught, and who knows...you might just get lucky too.

The Rules For Additions

General don'ts- No death, torture, violent rape (a little shy unwillingness and eventual succumbing is okay), or yaoi (boy/boy). Also, though I know they're big here, please no shrinking, growing, or body swapping. This is simple stuff here. If you want to add characters, you need to email me, same goes if you want to create a real, non "game over" ending.

1. General understanding of the source material- Please make sure you are somewhat familiar with these characters before posting. In addition to my character list, I would recommend doing some research, such as watching clips on YouTube.

2. This is a choose you own adventure story- Most of the interactive stories here have the reader in a god position. They choose what happens in the story next. Here the reader is more of a player in a game. The actions won't always have obvious consequences. So instead of saying "this happens" your character will make a choice based on what they know, and you write what happens. The reader/player is not supposed to know where this road will take them. So please keep that in mind.

3. Game overs- As this is a "game" of sorts, you can technically "lose" in that you get a game over or bad end based an certain choices. For instance, if you lose all your clothes as a girl. You might simply be embarrassed. Maybe they'll take pictures of you. Or they could make you masturbate, or possibly even have their way with you. That sort of thing. If you're playing as Souji, getting caught will result in a "game over." The girls might chase you away, beat you up, or even humiliate you, something like making you strip and masturbate.

4. Plying as the girls- When playing as the girls remember that you can't lose your clothes all at once. Say the girls are playing a strip game, you can't make a choice that makes you simply lose everything and get a bad end. Think of the clothing like a life bar. Every time you "lose" a round or something, you take something off. As such, you have to keep track of that. I suggest putting your character's status at the beginning of every chapter like I do.

5. Playing as the boys- This is a little more simple. Basically you'll be making choices while sneaking around. Some choices will get you towards what you want, and others will get you caught. Obviously, there will be multiple ways to succeed, but the boys' story is less complex than the girls, at least in terms of mechanics.

Cast of Characters:

The Girls

Chie Satonaka- Chie is a good humored, tomboyish high school junior. She is easygoing and gets along very well with both sexes. What she lacks in feminine qualities, she makes up for in spunk and a drive to help people. Chie is an avid fan of Hong Kong martial arts films, and practices kung fu regularly. Her favorite food is steak. Che is medium height with short brown hair and an athletic frame.

Yukiko Amagi- The daughter of the managers of the town's famous Amagi Inn, Yukiko is something like royalty in Inaba. She is next in line to inherit the Inn. She is shy, intelligent and elegant, though she does let her lighter side show among friends. Yukiko is often easily amused by stupid jokes, and breaks into unstoppable giggling fits. Chie and Yukiko have been best friends since they were little and they are in the same grade. Yukiko is tall and graceful, with long dark hair.

Rise Kujikawa- Formerly Japan's top idol, Rise left her work in stardom after becoming frustrated with her life always being the center of attention and constantly being over sexualized by the media. She returned to her hometown of Inaba for an indefinite hiatus from show business. She is peppy, excitable and often flirtatious. She is a first year high schooler (in Japan, there are only three years). Rise has dark brown hair that she wears in two pigtails. She has the body of a starlet.

Naoto Shirogane- Naoto is the latest in a line of famous detectives. For a long time, she masqueraded as a boy, believing no one would take her seriously as a girl, and because of her own negative outlook on the subject, as all of her detective heroes were men. With the help of her friends, she is beginning to accept her feminine side. Naoto has short blue hair, and though she usually hides it under masculine clothes, a rather feminine frame. It is hinted at in the game that her assets may be the most prominent among all of the girls. Naoto is also a first year.

Nanako Dojima- Often called Nana-Chan by the group, Nanako is Souji's cousin. She attends grade school, and the group as a whole tends to treat her like a little sister. Nanako lost her mom at a very young age, and due to her father's time-consuming job as a policeman, she has learned to be very independent and mature for her age. Despite this, she still likes to capture her childish side whenever she can.

The Boys

Souji Seta- The protagonist. He is a transfer student from the big city, who's capabilities make him a natural leader. He is respected and liked by all of the members of the investigation team. His personality is a blank slate, and thus he is defined by the player.

Yosuke Hanamura- The perfect right-hand man. Yosuke is loyal, good natured and always quick with a joke. He has no problem not being the leader. In fact, he prefers it that way. He is sometimes very clumsy, but nevertheless he usually ends up no worse for wear...at least...not much.

Kanji Tatsumi- A tough guy hooligan who actually has the heart of a teddy bear. Kanji enjoys knitting, sewing, dance and other non-conventional male activities.Though he is often made fun of for this, and his sexual orientation is called into question, Kanji is 99% sure he actually like girls. He just also likes doing the things girls do. He has a crush on Naoto, as he feels her gender confusions mirror his.

Teddie- A mysterious being found while exploring another world. At first Teddie appeared to them as a giant stuffed bear, but later he shed his outer shell to show his new friends that he had grown himself a body just like theirs. Teddie has an immature and overly amorous personality. Though he never gets anywhere with the girls using his heavy-handed come-ons, they do find it endearing to a slight degree. He often sabotages the other guys' chances to make any progress with the girls, not that he makes any himself.
